content:
Yes, there are many great restaurants in Cusco that offer a range of cuisines, from traditional Peruvian dishes to international cuisine. Here are some restaurant recommendations in Cusco:

1. Cicciolina: This is a popular restaurant with a cozy atmosphere that offers a variety of dishes made from local ingredients, including ceviche and quinoa salad. 2. MAP Café: Located inside the Pre-Columbian Art Museum, this restaurant serves modern Peruvian cuisine and offers an extensive wine list. 3. Chicha por Gastón Acurio: This restaurant, owned by famous Peruvian chef Gastón Acurio, offers traditional Peruvian dishes with a modern twist, such as roasted pork with Andean potatoes. 4. Limo: This is a Japanese-Peruvian fusion restaurant that offers dishes like sushi rolls with quinoa and tiradito with Amazonian fruit. 5. La Cusqueñita: This restaurant has a relaxed atmosphere and offers traditional Peruvian dishes like cuy (guinea pig) and alpaca steak. These are some of the many restaurants to consider when visiting Cusco. Make sure to check the opening hours and make a reservation to ensure a table.
